byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, James C. McKinley Jr., Benjamin Mueller and Jeffrey E. Singer.
byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and VIVIAN YEE

abstract: New York City Police Officer Peter Liang is charged in shooting death of Akai Gurley after grand jury hands down six-count indictment; charges include second-degree manslaughter; prosecutors allege that Liang dithered for four minutes before reporting that he had accidentally shot and killed Gurley in darkened staircase of Brooklyn housing project.
lead_paragraph: For four minutes after Officer Peter Liang fired his gun into a darkened housing project stairwell, he argued with his partner over whether to tell their superiors about the shot, prosecutors say.

headline.main: Officer Charged in Akai Gurley Case Debated Reporting Gunshot, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Officer Debated Reporting Shot in Brooklyn Stairwell, Officials Say

snippet: For four minutes after Officer Peter Liang fired his gun into a darkened housing project stairwell, he argued with his partner over whether to tell their superiors about the shot, prosecutors say.
